did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Thomas Henry Tibbles 1880 March 4

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Helen Hunt Jackson to Thomas Henry Tibbles, Accession #7080-b, Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased from Goodspeed's Book Shop on April 21, 1965, and accessioned on June 5, 1965.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Mentions a number of matters concerning American Indians: a report he had sent on the Cheyenne, the Byers letters in the Tribune which she calls "lies," names of tribes she is working on for her book. Asks if she can get information on the failures of the government in paying Indians, sends regards to Standing Bear, Bright Eyes, and Wood Worker.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Thomas Henry Tibbles 1880 Mar 4

scopecontent.p: Mentions a number of matters concerning American Indians: a report he had sent on the Cheyenne, the Byers letters in the Tribune which she calls "lies," names of tribes she is working on for her book. Asks if she can get information on the failures of the government in paying Indians, sends regards to Standing Bear, Bright Eyes, and Wood Worker.
